content.introduction: Solving equations with one unknown variable using various methods.

topics.description: A mathematical statement with an equal sign showing two expressions are equal.
examples: Variable can be any letter: x, y, z, etc.

topics.description: Methods to find the value of the variable.

topics.description: Bringing all variables to one side and constants to the other.

content.introduction: Understanding agricultural practices from sowing to harvesting and storage.

topics.title: Agricultural Practices
examples: Sowing - planting seeds at right depth and distance

examples: Kharif crops - sown in rainy season (June-July): rice, maize, cotton
Rabi crops - sown in winter (October-November): wheat, gram, mustard

chapters.title: The Best Christmas Present in the World

content.introduction: A touching story about a letter from World War I that becomes a precious Christmas gift.

topics.title: Story Summary
topics.description: The narrator finds an old letter in a roll-top desk, written by a soldier to his wife during WWI.
examples: British and German soldiers celebrated together
Old lady thinks narrator is her husband

topics.title: Theme
topics.description: Love, hope, and the futility of war.
examples: Peace and brotherhood matter more than conflict

exercises: Who wrote the letter and to whom?
What did the soldiers do on Christmas Day?
Why was the letter the best Christmas present?
